faq.name: faq
faq.label: FAQ
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Flux Generator
faq.description: Have another question? Contact us on Discord or by email.

items.title: What exactly is Flux Generator and how does it work?
items.description: Flux Generator is a comprehensive NextJS boilerplate designed specifically for building AI image generators. It provides ready-to-use templates, infrastructure setup, and deployment tools that help you launch your AI business in hours instead of days.

items.title: Do I need advanced technical skills to use Flux Generator?
items.description: While basic programming knowledge is helpful, Flux Generator is designed to be developer-friendly. Our templates and documentation make it easy to get started, even if you're not an expert in AI or cloud infrastructure.

items.title: What types of AI images can I build with Flux Generator?
items.description: Flux Generator supports a wide range of AI applications, from content generation to data analysis tools. Our templates cover popular use cases like AI chatbots, content generators, image processing apps, and more.

items.title: How long does it typically take to launch with Flux Generator?
items.description: With Flux Generator, you can have a working prototype in hours and a production-ready application in hours. Our one-click deployment and pre-configured infrastructure significantly reduce the traditional months-long development cycle.

items.title: What's included in the Flux Generator infrastructure?
items.description: Flux Generator provides a complete infrastructure stack including authentication, database setup, API integration, payment processing, and scalable cloud deployment. Everything is pre-configured following industry best practices.

items.title: Can I customize the templates to match my brand?
items.description: Absolutely! All Flux Generator templates are fully customizable. You can modify the design, features, and functionality to match your brand identity and specific business requirements while maintaining the robust underlying infrastructure.
